Sequence of the region coding for virion proteins C and E2 and the carboxy terminus of the nonstructural proteins of rubella virus: comparison with alphaviruses.

@article{Frey1988SequenceOT,
  title={Sequence of the region coding for virion proteins C and E2 and the carboxy terminus of the nonstructural proteins of rubella virus: comparison with alphaviruses.},
  author={Teryl K. Frey and Lucille Marr},
  journal={Gene},
  year={1988},
  volume={62 1},
  pages={
          85-99
        }
}
  • Teryl K. Frey, Lucille Marr
  • Published 1988
  • Biology, Medicine
  • Gene

    • The sequence of the 3' 4508 nucleotides (nt) of the genomic RNA of the Therien strain of rubella virus (RV) was determined for cDNA clones. The sequence contains a 3189-nt open reading frame (ORF) which codes for the structural proteins C, E2 and E1. C is predicted to have a length of 300 amino acids (aa). The N-terminal half of the C protein is highly basic and hydrophilic in nature, and is putatively the region of the protein which interacts with the virion RNA. At the C terminus of the C… CONTINUE READING
